channel.title: Whats Wrong With This?

item.title: Whats Wrong With This?
item.dc:creator: @sheeba sheeba
item.description:
@sheeba wrote:

why does it say emerald and rune longsword under the kills?

I even removed all the sendquests under the ones with the kill counts

Read full topic

item.title: Whats Wrong With This?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“sheeba, post:8, topic:239561”]lova ya Rich =p works perfect just what I need[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 27, 2008, 09:26:58 pm[/size][hr]why do I get a protect from range sign on the bottom right corner of screen

and how would I make this work for all 4 kinds without going over eachother in the top left corner[/quote]

Replace the writegw method with;

public void writegw() { setInterfaceWalkable(15892); sendQuest("@or1@NPC Killcount", 15894); sendQuest("@or1@Zamorak kills: @cya@ " + zammyKills, 15895); sendQuest("@or1@Armadyl kills:@cya@ " + armaKills, 15897); sendQuest("@or1@Bandos kills:@cya@ " + bandosKills, 15898); sendQuest("", 15897); sendQuest("", 15896); sendQuest("", 15902); sendQuest("", 15903); sendQuest("", 15904); sendQuest("", 15905); sendQuest("", 15906); }

You can do it from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats Wrong With This?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“hasumon, post:5, topic:239561”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=315844.msg2508922#msg2508922 date=1225163041]

Did you add it underneath the process/event manager/w-e?

If he did, he needs to remove it…
[/quote]
Wouldn’t he still need to have the ‘kills’ updated since all it is doing now is showing the interface with w-e its got now.[/quote]

Why not just do like I did…

public void writegw() { frame61(1); setInterfaceWalkable(4970); sendQuest("", 4963); sendQuest("", 4964); sendQuest("@or1@Saradomin kill", 4965); sendQuest("", 4966); sendQuest("@or1@count:", 4967); sendQuest("@cya@" + SarakillCount, 4968); sendQuest("@or1@God Wars Dungeon", 4969); }

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1264) { plr.SarakillCount += 1; plr.writegw(); ItemHandler.addItem(Item.randomsarakc(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

It updates the interface for the killcount, drops the item, without having it in process causing lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats Wrong With This?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Where you enter the area, (through a portal, or whatever), add the method there to show the interface, and whenever you teleport away (or use a portal, etc), to close it.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats Wrong With This?
item.dc:creator: @sheeba sheeba
item.description:
@sheeba wrote:

public void WritePlayers() { try { if (isInSheeba) { setInterfaceWalkable(15892); sendQuest("@whi@-@gre@Kills@whi@-", 15894); // Left hand side sendQuest("@gre@Zammorak Kills:@whi@ " + zammyKills, 15895); sendQuest("@gre@Arma Kills:@whi@ " + armaKills, 15897); sendQuest("@gre@Bandos Kills:@whi@ " + bandosKills, 15898); sendQuest("", 15897); sendQuest("", 15896); sendQuest("", 15902); sendQuest("", 15903); sendQuest("", 15904); sendQuest("", 15905); sendQuest("", 15906); } else if (!isInSheeba) { setInterfaceWalkable(-1); } } catch (Exception E) {} }

I have certian coords set-up for my area but when I go there the interface dosent show up.
(I took this out of ZDR but changed it to what I need)

Read full topic
